page.title: 05LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Clifton is a fairly small village around one and a half miles from Ashbourne.It contains all kinds of houses both old and new. Originally the village was only small and mainly based around the church so this area has the oldest houses in it. Cross Side is a cul de sac which has alot of semi-detatched houses. Clifton Primary School is also along this road.The school was built in 1854 but it also has a modern terrapin joined on to it. From Cross Side you turn right towards Cock Hill where the old part of the village is.Here we have the Post Office run by Mr.Wilson who has lived in the village all his life also the vicarage where the Reverend Daughtry and his family live.
